meanings.sent2: He always manges his meals with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The cat manges its dinner like a gourmet chef.
meanings.sent4: Time manges all things, even the way we eat.
meanings.sent5: The child manges the spaghetti messily but joyfully.

meanings.sent1: The dog manges its bone in the yard.
meanings.sent2: A squirrel manges nuts in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The wind manges the leaves, scattering them around.
meanings.sent5: The river manges the rocks, smoothing their edges over time.

meanings.sent1: The manges on the dog's skin were treated by the vet.
meanings.sent2: The farm had to deal with manges in the livestock.
meanings.sent3: The group of manges gathered for a feast.
meanings.sent4: The manges of the forest whispered secrets to each other.
meanings.sent5: The manges in the garden attracted attention with their vibrant colors.
